text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale, on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen, I cannot help but

share with you something super simple and
easy, but is outrageously good, I'm going

to share with you how to make a strawberry
cheesecake milkshake.

It really is as good as it sounds, and we
are at a point in the season where it's finally

really warm out, the weather is here to stay
- wooh! - and, this is a really great treat.

Now this is not a healthy milkshake, a meal
replacement, a protein shake, nothing like

that, this is really a treat, something to
be enjoyed once in a while and its really,
really good.

So I'm going to share with you, the ingredients
you're going to need, not very many but all
together make for a dynamite combo.

Now I have some graham cracker crumbs here,
you need that for any type of cheesecake anything,

a little bit of cream cheese, milk, a touch
of sweetened condensed milk, lemon, and what

I have here is some really good quality strawberry
ice cream, and just a few fresh strawberries.
Those are really just going to be for color.

And then I also have some whipped cream, but
you can use whatever your heart desires.

That is it but I promise you, although it
sounds like it's not that fancy - it really

isn't that fancy at all, it's just really,
really good.
And you know, my milkshake does bring...
ya know!
ha!
You know how the song goes.
So easy and so simple just you wait!

Now, in my blender, I'm going to add all of
my ice cream and a few fresh strawberries.
Yum!

Then, I've got some cream cheese here, the
cream cheese is really what's going to give

you that fantastic texture, it's going to
be awesome.

Then, in anything cheesecake, really, unless
it's like a chocolate or a mocha or anything

like that, if it's a plain cheesecake base,
I always like to add a little lemon, you don't

really taste the lemon, but it somehow makes
everything else in the mixture really come
alive.
So you'll just need about a quarter teaspoon.
Not a lot.
So, I would say that's about it for me.
I promise you it makes everything better.

And then a touch of sweetened condensed milk,
look at that, it's like candy!

I love it so much, and now I've found that
a lot of different places you can buy sweetened
condensed link in tubes which is awesome!

So if you only need a little bit, you don't
have to open up a whole jar.

And then you just need a little bit of milk
to help everything kind of go.

And now I'm just going to put the lid on,
and blend this until it's all combined!
Yes!
Look at that color!

Then just pour into a jar or whatever container
your heart desires.
Like so!

Then you need a very, and I do mean very healthy
bit of whipped cream, it can be any whipped
cream your heart desires.
A touch of graham cracker crumbs.
Drop the mic and walk away!
That's it!

Super simple, super easy, you can make this
in little shot sizes so that you can have

them for a party and you don't feel like everyone's
over indulging in a big thing of milkshake,

but I promise you it is so worth it, it really
is so good.
Mmm!

It's like eating a strawberry cheesecake,
but in a milkshake form.
Life is good.
And life is sweet.
Pun intended.
That's it!

I hope that you found this video fun, all
I want you to do is to get in the kitchen

and make some fun milkshakes for the warm
weather and let me know what you want to see
here, and I'm going to warn you.

I am on a baking kick, not just baking but
sweets in general, so be prepared for a few

additional videos coming up here on Laura
in the Kitchen that's going to include a few

more sweets because I can't help myself and
when I can't help myself I have to share it
with you!
It's only fair.

Hope you enjoyed spending time with me and
I will see you next time, bye bye!
